frame.name: Rejuvenation
frame.definition:
<def-root>The action of an <fen>Agent</fen> or the occurrence of a <fen>Cause</fen> event returns an <fen>Entity</fen> to an earlier state of vigor and strength.
<ex><fex name="Cause">Falling prices and wireless connectivity</fex> have <t>breathed new life</t> <fex name="Entity">into the PDA market</fex>. </ex>
<ex>While <fex name="Agent">Paul Reubens</fex> <t>resuscitates</t> <fex name="Entity">his career</fex>, Pee-wee fans use the Web to keep the 'adventure' alive.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Entity">Athens' democracy</fex> was <fex name="eve">unexpectedly</fex> <t>reinvigorated</t> <fex name="Cause">by its great defeat</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Entity
FE.definition:
<def-root>The concrete or abstract thing that is brought into an earlier state in which it was more effective and powerful.
<ex>The <t>reinvigoration</t> <fex name="ent">of the tourism</fex> economy is recognised by many as an ambitious but necessary objective.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> puts the <fen>Entity</fen> into a state of renewed vigor.
<ex><fex name="Agt">We</fex> <t>revitalized</t> the Golden Mountaineer Card, and we gave seniors a prescription drug benefit.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the place where the Agent brings about the change in the <fen>Entity</fen>'s state.
<ex>New York's distinction as America's tax cut leader has <t>revitalized</t> the economy <fex name="Place">in every corner of the state</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the purpose for which an <fen>Agent</fen> brings about the revitalization of the <fen>Entity</fen>.
<ex>Older neighborhoods throughout the area should be <t>revitalized</t> <fex name="Purp">in order to be retained as neighborhoods having unique identities</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> causes the renewal of the <fen>Entity</fen>.
<ex>Production was <t>revitalized</t> <fex name="Time">last June</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the action that the <fen>Agent</fen> performs in order so as to bring about the reinvigoration of the <fen>Entity</fen>.
<ex>Natalie Cole <t>resuscitated</t> her career <fex name="Means">by recording a posthumous duet with her father on his old hit "Unforgettable"</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the intentional act which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Agent</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>).
<ex>They assessed the effectiveness of four different species of native trees for <fex name="Mnr">rapid</fex> <t>rejuvenation</t> of the mined land.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Domain
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Domain</fen> within which the <fen>Entity</fen> is affected.
<ex>Course wares and websites should be changed and <t>renewed</t> <fex name="dom">creatively</fex> often.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Iterations
FE.definition:
<def-root>The number of times that an <fen>Entity</fen> is caused to return to a more effective state.
<ex>Ancient Egypt twice fell into a similar state of decrepitude, and was <fex name="ite">twice</fex> <t>rejuvenated</t> and suffused with energy and artistic creativeness.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Cause
FE.definition:
<def-root>An event or state whose occurrence brings about the <fen>Entity</fen>'s return to a vigorous state.
<ex>Rock has been <t>rejuvenated</t> creatively and commercially <fex name="cau">by hip-hop-inspired rock acts</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Event_description
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE is used for phrases that describe the clause of the target as a whole, either appraisals of the event, or descriptions of the rejuvenation event as role fillers in other frames.
<ex>Blair's career was <fex name="eve">miraculously</fex> <t>revitalized</t>, personal liberties were compromised, and the global neocon war-agenda moved forward.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Frequency
FE.definition: <def-root>This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time. A Frequency expression answers the question how often. </def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>This frame element selects some gradable attribute and modifies the expected value for it.</def-root>

FE.name: Instrument
FE.definition: <def-root>The device used by the <fen>Agent</fen> to help accomplish the action indicated by the target. </def-root>

FE.name: Role
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Role</fen> is used for the capacity in which the <fen>Entity</fen> is Rejuvinated, and is expressed in <ment>as</ment>-PPs.</def-root>

FE.name: Result
FE.definition: <def-root>The end state of the Rejuvination action. </def-root>
